page.title: 13BOWNESS-ON-SOLWAY.DEMOGRAPHY
page.content: Ages of residents:0-5yrs(10),5-17(34) 18(5),19-59(115),60-79(26),80-95(14). Bowness Primary school had 101 pupils aged 4+ on 1/9/1984 to 11+ in July 1985. Parents, Buses (Ribble or Private operators) or Taxis bring them from all parts of the Parish. Most pupils have lunch cooked in the school kitchen. Some bring packed lunch. There are 5 teachers and also visiting specialists for Violin and for Special Educational Needs.The school is a very happy place with much parental involvement. At 11, pupils go to Nelson Thomlinson, Wigton, for their Secondary Education up to 16 or to Sixth Form level. Roman Catholic children attend school in Wigton or Carlisle, as do children whose parents want them educated privately. The Handicapped have Special schools in Wigton or Carlisle.{CONTRIBUTORS P.20
